intro: Chelidonium japonicum, commonly known as Japanese greater celandine, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are typically lobed and hairy. It is often found in moist, woodland habitats and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant contains alkaloids and has been used in traditional medicine, though it is toxic if ingested.
